text: Thanks for all your tutorials sentdex.  Along with your tutorials and other tutorials, I managed to create my first android app and submitted it to GooglePlay. I was tempted to give up many times due to installation problems, versioning problems, steep learning curve and not programming for 10+ years. But if you persevere you will overcome all hurdles. Anyway here is my app. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.nikosgrikos.numbojumbo

author: @jitheshkuyyalil
text: Thanks for a wonderful tutorial.  It was a great help.  Here is one of the solutions to your exercise in video 12 to add a clear button to the painter app:  #: import FadeTransition kivy.uix.screenmanager.FadeTransition  ScreenManage:    transition: FadeTransition()    ScreenOne:    ScreenTwo:  <ScreenOne>:    name: "Home"    Button:       on_release: app.root.current = "Painter"       text: "Painter"       font_size: 50  <ScreenTwo>:    name: "Painter"    FloatLayout:       MyPainter:          id: my_painter       Button:          size_hint: 0.3, 0.2          text: "home"          pos: 0, 0          on_release: app.root.current = "Home"       Button:          size_hint: 0.3, 0.2          text: "clear"          pos_hint: {'right':1, 'top':1}          on_release: my_painter.canvas.clear()

author: @SubwayToSally90
text: Installing pygame with pip was and is always a pain in the bu..  First of all, It's not (directly) listed on pypi and also on a unverified source. To run the pip command, you have to do:   pip install pygame --allow-external pygame --allow-unverified pygame  which (currently on 17.12.2015) leads to an HTTP error 400. I suggest installing it another way.
